item.title: Congratulating the San Jose Earthquakes for winning the 2003 Major League Soccer Cup.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S16202; text as passed Senate: CR S16202; text of measure as introduced: CR S16140-16141)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S16202; text as passed Senate: CR S16202; text of measure as introduced: CR S16140-16141)

summary.text: Congratulates the San Jose Earthquakes for winning the 2003 Major League Soccer Cup.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Congratulates the San Jose Earthquakes for winning the 2003 Major League Soccer Cup. Commends the San Jose community for its support of the team and expresses hope that Major League Soccer will continue to inspire fans and young players.

bill.title: A resolution congratulating the San Jose Earthquakes for winning the 2003 Major League Soccer Cup.

item.title: A resolution congratulating the San Jose Earthquakes for winning the 2003 Major League Soccer Cup.
A resolution congratulating the San Jose Earthquakes for winning the 2003 Major League Soccer Cup.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S16202; text as passed Senate: CR S16202; text of measure as introduced: CR S16140-16141)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
